alert.note: Alert for Orange; Osceola; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 1:42PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Lake, southwestern Orange and northwestern Osceola Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 142 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Four Corners, or 7 miles west of Bay Lake, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ocoee, Winter Garden, Windermere, Bay Lake and Celebration. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
